intro: Orchis coriophora proles martrinii, commonly known as the Martirini's small helleborine, is a rare orchid species native to specific regions of Europe. It is a terrestrial herb with a slender, erect stem and a single, lance-shaped leaf. The plant produces a single, pale green to yellowish flower with a distinctive, intricate lip. It thrives in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
